channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Context and System Fusion in Post-ASR Emotion Recognition with Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have started to play a vital role in modelling speech and text.

item.title: Beyond Film Subtitles: Is YouTube the Best Approximation of Spoken Vocabulary?
item.description: Word frequency is a key variable in psycholinguistics, useful for modeling human familiarity with words even in the era of large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Looking into Concept Explanation Methods for Diabetic Retinopathy Classification
item.description: Diabetic retinopathy is a common complication of diabetes, and monitoring the progression of retinal abnormalities using fundus imaging is crucial.

item.title: Investigating and Mitigating Object Hallucinations in Pretrained Vision-Language (CLIP) Models
item.description: Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) have achieved impressive performance, yet research has pointed out a serious issue with object hallucinations within these models.

item.title: Make Interval Bound Propagation great again
item.description: Two crucial problems in NNC are of profound interest to the scientific community: how to calculate the robustness of a given pre-trained network and how to construct robust networks.

item.title: Multi-Robot Motion Planning with Diffusion Models
item.description: Diffusion models have recently been successfully applied to a wide range of robotics applications for learning complex multi-modal behaviors from data.

item.title: Lightning UQ Box: A Comprehensive Framework for Uncertainty Quantification in Deep Learning
item.description: Uncertainty quantification (UQ) is an essential tool for applying deep neural networks (DNNs) to real world tasks, as it attaches a degree of confidence to DNN outputs.

item.title: Aligning LLMs with Individual Preferences via Interaction
item.description: To address this gap, we train LLMs that can ''interact to align'', essentially cultivating the meta-skill of LLMs to implicitly infer the unspoken personalized preferences of the current user through multi-turn conversations, and then dynamically align their following behaviors and responses to these inferred preferences.

item.title: Exploring the Benefit of Activation Sparsity in Pre-training
item.description: SSD adaptively switches between the Mixtures-of-Experts (MoE) based sparse training and the conventional dense training during the pre-training process, leveraging the efficiency of sparse training and avoiding the static activation correlation of sparse training.

item.title: Redefining Temporal Modeling in Video Diffusion: The Vectorized Timestep Approach
item.description: Diffusion models have revolutionized image generation, and their extension to video generation has shown promise.

item.title: Adaptive BPE Tokenization for Enhanced Vocabulary Adaptation in Finetuning Pretrained Language Models
item.description: Current approaches trivially append the target domain-specific vocabulary at the end of the PLM vocabulary.

item.title: Grounded-VideoLLM: Sharpening Fine-grained Temporal Grounding in Video Large Language Models
item.description: Video Large Language Models (Video-LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in coarse-grained video understanding, however, they struggle with fine-grained temporal grounding.

item.title: Does SpatioTemporal information benefit Two video summarization benchmarks?
item.description: These models achieved state-of-the-art correlation scores on important benchmark datasets.

item.title: EXAQ: Exponent Aware Quantization For LLMs Acceleration
item.description: The combination of accelerating both $e^x$ and $\sum(e^x)$ results in a 36. 9% acceleration in the softmax operation.

item.title: Variational Bayes Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Recently, 3D Gaussian Splatting has emerged as a promising approach for modeling 3D scenes using mixtures of Gaussians.

item.title: Not All Diffusion Model Activations Have Been Evaluated as Discriminative Features
item.description: To this end, the early study of this field performs a large-scale quantitative comparison of the discriminative ability of the activations.

item.title: Cayley Graph Propagation
item.description: One well regarded family of bottleneck-free graphs within the mathematical community are expander graphs, with prior work$\unicode{x2014}$Expander Graph Propagation (EGP)$\unicode{x2014}$proposing the use of a well-known expander graph family$\unicode{x2014}$the Cayley graphs of the $\mathrm{SL}(2,\mathbb{Z}_n)$ special linear group$\unicode{x2014}$as a computational template for GNNs.

item.title: Dynamic Diffusion Transformer
item.description: In addition, we design a Spatial-wise Dynamic Token (SDT) strategy to avoid redundant computation at unnecessary spatial locations.

item.title: Unlearnable 3D Point Clouds: Class-wise Transformation Is All You Need
item.description: Traditional unlearnable strategies have been proposed to prevent unauthorized users from training on the 2D image data.

item.title: Mitigating Adversarial Perturbations for Deep Reinforcement Learning via Vector Quantization
item.description: Recent studies reveal that well-performing reinforcement learning (RL) agents in training often lack resilience against adversarial perturbations during deployment.

item.title: MBDS: A Multi-Body Dynamics Simulation Dataset for Graph Networks Simulators
item.description: The datasets employed for training and evaluating physical simulation techniques are typically generated by researchers themselves, often resulting in limited data volume and quality.

item.title: ARB-LLM: Alternating Refined Binarizations for Large Language Models
item.description: However, current binarization methods struggle to narrow the distribution gap between binarized and full-precision weights, while also overlooking the column deviation in LLM weight distribution.

item.title: FedCert: Federated Accuracy Certification
item.description: To tackle this challenge, this study proposed a method named FedCert to take the first step toward evaluating the robustness of FL systems.

item.title: ECHOPulse: ECG controlled echocardio-grams video generation
item.description: Echocardiography (ECHO) is essential for cardiac assessments, but its video quality and interpretation heavily relies on manual expertise, leading to inconsistent results from clinical and portable devices.

item.title: Manikin-Recorded Cardiopulmonary Sounds Dataset Using Digital Stethoscope
item.description: In this dataset, we used a digital stethoscope to capture both heart and lung sounds, including individual and mixed recordings.

item.title: Tadashi: Enabling AI-Based Automated Code Generation With Guaranteed Correctness
item.description: Frameworks and DSLs auto-generating code have traditionally relied on human experts developing them to have in place rigorous methods to assure the legality of the applied code transformations.

item.title: GraphCroc: Cross-Correlation Autoencoder for Graph Structural Reconstruction
item.description: Graph-structured data is integral to many applications, prompting the development of various graph representation methods.

item.title: Entanglement-induced provable and robust quantum learning advantages
item.description: We demonstrate, through both numerical simulations and trapped-ion experiments on IonQ Aria, the desired quantum-classical learning separation.

item.title: CommonIT: Commonality-Aware Instruction Tuning for Large Language Models via Data Partitions
item.description: With instruction tuning, Large Language Models (LLMs) can enhance their ability to adhere to commands.

item.title: Enriching Ontologies with Disjointness Axioms using Large Language Models
item.description: Ontologies often lack explicit disjointness declarations between classes, despite their usefulness for sophisticated reasoning and consistency checking in Knowledge Graphs.

item.title: Generative Artificial Intelligence for Navigating Synthesizable Chemical Space
item.description: We demonstrate SynFormer's effectiveness in two key applications: (1) local chemical space exploration, where the model generates synthesizable analogs of a reference molecule, and (2) global chemical space exploration, where the model aims to identify optimal molecules according to a black-box property prediction oracle.

item.title: Semantic Segmentation Based Quality Control of Histopathology Whole Slide Images
item.description: We developed a software pipeline for quality control (QC) of histopathology whole slide images (WSIs) that segments various regions, such as blurs of different levels, tissue regions, tissue folds, and pen marks.

item.title: FedStein: Enhancing Multi-Domain Federated Learning Through James-Stein Estimator
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) facilitates data privacy by enabling collaborative in-situ training across decentralized clients.

item.title: Autoregressive Action Sequence Learning for Robotic Manipulation
item.description: We propose the Chunking Causal Transformer (CCT), which extends the next-single-token prediction of causal transformers to support multi-token prediction in a single pass.

item.title: Mamba in Vision: A Comprehensive Survey of Techniques and Applications
item.description: Mamba is emerging as a novel approach to overcome the challenges faced by Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Vision Transformers (ViTs) in computer vision.

item.title: Table Question Answering for Low-resourced Indic Languages
item.description: TableQA models trained on our large-scale datasets outperform state-of-the-art LLMs.

item.title: AutoPenBench: Benchmarking Generative Agents for Penetration Testing
item.description: We assess the agent performance with generic and specific milestones that allow us to compare results in a standardised manner and understand the limits of the agent under test.

item.title: Real-World Benchmarks Make Membership Inference Attacks Fail on Diffusion Models
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, we are the first to discover the performance overestimation of MIAs on diffusion models and present a unified benchmark for more realistic evaluation.

item.title: Action Selection Learning for Multi-label Multi-view Action Recognition
item.description: Existing work has focused on multi-view action recognition in a narrow area with strong labels available, where the onset and offset of each action are labeled at the frame-level.

item.title: On Uncertainty In Natural Language Processing
item.description: The last decade in deep learning has brought on increasingly capable systems that are deployed on a wide variety of applications.

item.title: Curvature Diversity-Driven Deformation and Domain Alignment for Point Cloud
item.description: Our approach first introduces a \textit{\textbf{Curv}ature Diversity-driven Deformation \textbf{Rec}onstruction (CurvRec)} task, which effectively mitigates the gap between the source and target domains by enabling the model to extract salient features from semantically rich regions of a given point cloud.

item.title: HiddenGuard: Fine-Grained Safe Generation with Specialized Representation Router
item.description: Ideally, LLMs should provide informative responses while avoiding the disclosure of harmful or sensitive information.

item.title: BadCM: Invisible Backdoor Attack Against Cross-Modal Learning
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel bilateral backdoor to fill in the missing pieces of the puzzle in the cross-modal backdoor and propose a generalized invisible backdoor framework against cross-modal learning (BadCM).

item.title: SynCo: Synthetic Hard Negatives in Contrastive Learning for Better Unsupervised Visual Representations
item.description: To address this, we introduce SynCo (Synthetic Negatives in Contrastive learning), a novel contrastive learning approach that improves model performance by generating synthetic hard negatives.

item.title: Agents' Room: Narrative Generation through Multi-step Collaboration
item.description: Writing compelling fiction is a multifaceted process combining elements such as crafting a plot, developing interesting characters, and using evocative language.

item.title: Towards Implicit Bias Detection and Mitigation in Multi-Agent LLM Interactions
item.description: To that end, our study investigates the presence of implicit gender biases in multi-agent LLM interactions and proposes two strategies to mitigate these biases.

item.title: SCA: Highly Efficient Semantic-Consistent Unrestricted Adversarial Attack
item.description: Unrestricted adversarial attacks typically manipulate the semantic content of an image (e. g., color or texture) to create adversarial examples that are both effective and photorealistic.

item.title: MetaMetrics: Calibrating Metrics For Generation Tasks Using Human Preferences
item.description: This makes MetaMetrics a powerful tool for improving the evaluation of generation tasks, ensuring that metrics are more representative of human judgment across diverse contexts.

item.title: Can Large Language Models Grasp Legal Theories? Enhance Legal Reasoning with Insights from Multi-Agent Collaboration
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) could struggle to fully understand legal theories and perform complex legal reasoning tasks.

item.title: General Preference Modeling with Preference Representations for Aligning Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce preference representation learning, an approach that embeds responses into a latent space to capture intricate preference structures efficiently, achieving linear query complexity.
